question.text: Hybridisation, shape and magnetic moment of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></math> is

options.text: <math><msup><mrow><mtext>d</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext><mtext>p</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">o</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">c</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">t</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">h</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">d</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">l</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mn>4.9</mn><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">B</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">M</mtext></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext><mtext>p</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>d</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">o</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">c</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">t</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">h</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">d</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">l</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mn>4.9</mn><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">B</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">M</mtext></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mtext>d</mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mtext>p</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">s</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">q</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">u</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">p</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">l</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">n</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mn>4.9</mn><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">B</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">M</mtext></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext><mtext>p</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">t</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">t</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">h</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">e</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">d</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">r</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">a</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">l</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext mathvariant="normal"> </mtext><mn>4.9</mn><mtext mathvariant="normal">B</mtext><mtext mathvariant="normal">M</mtext></math>

solution.text:
In K3CoCO33, cobalt shows the +3 oxidation state i.e., (d6) ion. Hence, Co (+3) has four unpaired electrons so, it is paramagnetic.

The magnetic moment of Co(+3)

In K3CoCO33=nn+2 BM

=44+2 BM=4.9 BM

Where, n=number of unpaired electrons

CO32- is a weak field bidentate ligand, so 3CO32- ligands occupy six orbitals, thus it shows sp3 d2 hybridisation and octahedral in shape.
